definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: First, the starting point of marketing is wet.
sentences.chinese: 第一，营销的始点是湿的。

sentences.english: Perhaps because self-organised criticality is the perfect starting point for many of the brain's functions.
sentences.chinese: 可能因为自我组织临界是许多脑功能的完美始点。

sentences.english: Girtim, British artist, created watercolour with a modern meaning.
sentences.chinese: 具有现代意义的水彩画，始点当首推英国画家格尔丁。

sentences.english: Chaos is the starting point of matters in Universe.
sentences.chinese: 混沌在我们这个宇审中是物质进行的始点。

sentences.english: Specify the aiming point for the reflector start point.
sentences.chinese: 为反射器始点指定瞄准点。

definition: the end/end point/finishing line (in a race)/destination/terminus/CL:個|个[ge4]
